title: ImportError for SHAP GPUTree: DLL load failed while importing _cext_gpu
body:
Hi there, I was looking into GPUTreeExplainer to take advantage of GPU to speed up shap values calculations for large data set. 

I tried to build the shap package similar to the link below:
https://github.com/slundberg/shap/issues/1650#issuecomment-746985816

I was using pyenv-win and has python 3.8.7 installed.

In the stack trace, it read that a DLL could not be found
```
File "...\tmp\shap\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 105, in shap_values
    assert_import("cext_gpu")
  File "...\tmp\shap\shap\utils\_general.py", line 23, in assert_import
    raise e
  File "...\tmp\shap\shap\explainers\_gpu_tree.py", line 6, in <module>
    from .. import _cext_gpu
ImportError: DLL load failed while importing _cext_gpu: The specified module could not be found.
```

I then used [dependency walker](https://github.com/lucasg/Dependencies) in Windows to trace which DLL is missing, and found that `python38.dll` went missing for `_cext_gpu.cp38-win_amd64.pyd`

I tried to re-install Python 3.8.7 with Windows Installer from python.org and obtained the python38.dll, but I wasn't sure where to put it for the import to work. Highly appreciate if someone could point me to the correct way of doing this. Thanks!
